course.subject: SOSC
course.name: The Chinese Cultural Revolution: A Case Study in Politico-Social Movements
course.description: This course guides students to explore the causes, processes, and long impact of the Chinese Cultural Revolution (CR) of 1966-76. As one of the most critical periods in Chinaâ€™s 20th century, such a massive sociopolitical upheaval and violence not only caused many deaths, dismantled the bureaucracy and crushed the economy, but also inspired radical politico-social movements in Hong Kong, Western Europe, Japan, North America and etc. Firsthand sources and accounts on the CR will be examined together with scholarly studies concerning the CR and the 20th century radicalism worldwide.

reviews.author: yy12345678
reviews.comment_content: It is about the Chinese history during the cultural revolution. Focus on the internal conflict inside the party.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor organised his teaching material and TA will help with the notes. But it would be really helpful if you can do notes quickly since no ppt is provided.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. Professor comment a lot on the essays.
reviews.comment_workload: Readings required. But really depends on the ways of midterm and final exam. If it is for essay, you have to do some in depth reading, not sure if the midterm is in the form of  exam.

reviews.author: llchan
reviews.title: A story-like course
reviews.comment_content:
The course is about the development and the impact of the Cultural Revolution.
The professor was like a story teller on CR.
Lively and detail description on the relationship and the mentality of different leader like Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai.
The policy and the power distribution in the central government and the army was clearly illustrated and analysed.
Despite the clear explanation, there was extensive readingssssssss for you to read, which I could never finish.
If you cannot finish a thick book of reading, to SIT-IN his class will be a better alternative.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is knowledgeable in Cultural Revolution.
If you want to have a better understanding on Cultural Revolution or have a close reading on the required text, you have better listen to what the professor said.
If you missed his word, you better ask the people next to you or the TA , or you will find it hard to catch it up.
He is patient in giving advice to your work if you face any difficulty, he will kindly offer help to you.
reviews.comment_grading: The course weigh much on the assignment. The professor set a high standard on the assignment. He expect to see a high quality essay than other Humanities or Social Science stream professors.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was heavy although there is only two assignment throughout the semester.
For the mid term you have to write 7 pages for a reading that you have done and it's related to the Cultural Revolution development.
For the final you have to write 15 pages for a Cultural Revolution development in a province.
It will become a nightmare if you cannot finish the reading or if you cannot analyse it well. The assignment was too tough for me and I can barely finish it.
